intro: Conostylis crassinerva subsp. absens, commonly known as the slender-leafed conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This subspecies is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem.
